metadata.title: CVE-2013-6444 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
PyWBEM 0.7 and earlier does not verify that the server hostname matches adomain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field ofthe X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoofSSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pywbem - 0.8.0~dev650-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pywbem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.0~dev650-1').
